replies.commentBody: Well, that's not surprising that you believe RT and Pravda over the American press.  That's what you've been told to believe by Bannon and his crew.

Most media outlets - print, cable, network, internet - are reporting this story as valid (Fox, of course, has spun in around to blame Democrats, no surprise there). I urge you to open up your world and read/see some different perspectives: NPR, PBS, BBC, CBC, Wall Street Journal, USA Today, Bloomberg, Chicago Tribune, LA Times, Washington Post, The Nation, The Economist and AllSides.com.

Republicans – including George Bush and Lindsay Graham – are asking for an independent inquiry. How are you Republican supporters able live in a constant state of cognitive dissonance? It must be exhausting to constantly defend against the constant tide of lies, ignorance and misinformation.

comments.commentBody:
The New York Times has sunk to a new low. Obama has sunk to a new low. What a disgrace both of them are.

OUr President was legally elected and now the NYT and Obama are trying to find a way to remove him from office. This is a disgrace and both should be punished.

Of course the left wing readership of this paper laps up all these fairy stories.
Personally I have come to believe that RT and Pravda are more truthful than either the NYT or MSNBC. That is how low you have both sunk in my opinion.'

First they got rid of General Flynn and now they want to get rid of the President. The reporters are a disgrace and are not reports but propagandists.
We are not free if we have publications undermining our government and that is what the NYT is doing.
So President Obama saved America coming into office, and he may have saved us as he prepared to leave office too.

Timing is everything. Bernie Sanders was the only plenipotentiary positioned to gain any momentum from the DNC getting duped. With all the blame going the other way it was, so it would seem a free one way ticket to the top of his party.
Time for an independent special prosecutor to do a thorough investigation. This may be a case of politics crossing the line into criminal activity, even treason.

For those who think the NY Times and the Washington Post are in a war with each other, a word I have heard bandied about on the networks, nothing could be further from the truth. The online editorial from the Times this morning concerning the latest news on Russian contacts with the Trump campaign included a link to the Washington Post story about Jeff Sessions and his two contacts with the Russian ambassador in July and September of 2016, prior to the election.
If there is a war between these two institutions it is a race to the truth, for which we are eternally grateful. Unfortunately, the Trump administration and the Republican Congress are in a similar war, although their race to deception has an ever receding finish line.

replies.commentBody: Trump has been getting away with things his whole life.  He never dreamed that his luck would finally run out.

comments.commentBody:
Imagine the rightwing screaming if this story was about the Russians hacking to help Hillary. Imagine the rightwing screaming if it were Obama or Hillary that ordered the disastrous attack in Yemen.

The real question is where is the screaming from all Americans over the Russians helping Trump and Trumps disastrous order to attack Yemen?

Of course the did kids, they were bitter, sore losers. Many hoped to keep their jobs with HRC.

The NYT needs to start revealing it's "unnamed sources". Low level hacks? or honest to goodness government officials.

Here are the facts:

The information hacked from Clinton campaign and DNC were self generated communications.

Our government cannot pinpoint the source(s) of the hack, they can only guess.

No one knows the motivation of said hacks, other than the hackers themselves. Perhaps they were killing time, or looking for fun, or wanted Trump as President because he is a Russian double agent,

If we couldn't find out what really happened in Benghazi, or why HRC sold uranium to Russia after a Russian bank paid her husband to speak, then we will never know.

Move on NYT, you are looking more and more foolish every day.

It's more than mere curiosity that leads us to wonder who from the Trump campaign was meeting in Europe with the Russians. Every American should be concerned about what took place during the campaign while Putin was seeking to undermine our elections.

Sessions says that his meetings with the Russian diplomat were a regular type of meeting for senators... I would like to know to what extent the same Russian (or other Russians connected with Russian intelligence) met with democratic senators/congressmen or members of the Hillary team. For some reason I doubt there was the same level of contact....
Regardless of the content of Session's meetings with the Russians...are there not consequences for those who lie to Congress ?

This article is based on information "according to three former American officials who requested anonymity in discussing classified intelligence." so why would I believe any of it? First, they are discussing classified intelligence which makes them treasonous. Second, they are former officials, sour grapes anyone and third, they are anonymous, they could say anything and it is unverifiable, hence, hearsay. Bogus wannbe article from NYT.

replies.commentBody: And where are their screeches about Trump & Co's. use of private email servers?  And Yemen?  So very quiet...

comments.commentBody:
To those who think it's unfair to conduct an inquiry into the Trump campaigns ties to Russia, a dangerous foreign adversary, please explain why this issue, which could threaten U.S security, should be ignored.

You are undoubtedly the same people who relished investigating Bill Clinton's private life, Benghazi, and Hillary's private server. You obviously think justice applies to Democrats, and Republicans should be allowed carte blanche.

replies.commentBody: Really?  Where are you getting this data from?

comments.commentBody: The Russians did not pull the levers for Trump, Americans did.  Over a million illegal aliens are estimated to have pulled the levers for Hillary though.   Obama's deliberate obstruction of the incoming administration has set a new low, basically planting land mines while going out the door to create a myriad of problems for the new administration.  That is the story along with Obama staying in Washington DC to continue agitating and harrassing the new administration in an attempt to save his legacy.  IT really doesn't matter whether Trump's people talked to Russian officials or not, this paper has already made up its mind and just keeps feeding red meat to its readers.  Good luck with that!

Heroic effort by the outgoing admin,true patriots....and kudo's to the NYT for spending so much time and effort on this mega piece... The public now knows there was communication between two countries.That Putin was helping Trump because he was terrified of Hillary's "reset" button and Obama's stauch defense of the Ukraine and Crimea.Obama and Hillary really showed Putin who was boss.He was so afraid of Obama's lead from behind strategy that he wanted to promote the weak little mouse Trump...Putin knows it will be easier to deal with someone who puts America first than it was to deal with someone who looked the other way and let him do whatever he wants....Sure,Putin prefers Trump,he is getting bored always getting his way...Great "real" journalism.
If the New York Times didn't have fake news, it wouldn't have any new at all.

Highest law enforcer in the nation.  He's up to his Beauregard in lies.  No.  Jiff.  You lied.  You're fired.  Your penalties: scrape the bull dung from your sneakers.  Inhale cannabis.  You're from way back big time States Rights Alabama.  Pick strawberries with those you would round up and tell to go back to their own country.  You represent the worst instincts and most nefarious traits of white nationalist Dave Duke white hooded, blind men who stop at nothing to gain and abuse power.  Death to your political self. You would be hoodwinker and mountebank and loser.

The correct answer for Mr. Sessions: "Yes, I did on a couple of occasions briefly speak to the Ambassador as a campaign "surrogate" and not in my capacity as a member of Senate Armed Services Committee, or the Judiciary's Subcomittee on Crime and Terrorism, or the Nuclear Safety Subcommittee..it was just friendly chit chat"

President Obama's intelligence will trump Trump every time.  He sowed the seeds of Trump's impeachment and the chorus continues to grow and grow. Flynn, next up Jeff Sessions, ... .  The circle of wagons around Trump gets smaller and smaller ... pretty soon we'll all know the pivotal role he likely played.
Too bad #45 isn't competent to stand trial.  Obviously he is so clueless he has no idea of all this business going on around him.  Poor guy, being used like this.  Send him to the showers ...
Looks like President Trump needs to do a little digging on Obama.
Just about all blogs strongly expressing anti-Trump feelings and blindly following NYT views.   Tar and Feathers in the 21st century; very Interesting.
And this is the story. And nothing else is the story!
